notes from the designer:

horology is the study and measurement of time. i have always been fascinated by clocks and timekeeping beginning in my school days when i learned how various ancient cultures used water clocks to track the passage of time. inspired by a repeating lace pattern called ginkgo leaves and knitted with the zodiac hues luster sport mini kit, this pattern will hopefully delight you for many hours to come. 

* click [here][6] to watch as i show you how to knit this shawl, including how to add beads.
* the sample shown used approximately 1966 yds/1798 m total: color a: 175 yds/160 m, color b: 168 yds/154 m, colors c – j: 160 yds/146 m each, color k: 168 yds/154 m, and color l: 175 yds/ 160 m. avoid using colors a, b, k, or l when making your gauge swatch.
* the sample was knit using the colors in this order: magenta, dark red, red, orange, yellow, green, light blue-green, teal, dark blue, blue, cool violet, and warm purple.
* **tip**: before you begin, tag and weigh each skein with the color you want to use, so you don't mix them up.
* the weights on the mini skeins are approximate and will vary. most skeins range between 1.6 oz– 1.9 oz (45–55 grams) each. if you have a skein that is smaller, you can adjust the number of rows you work before you change colors.
* the pattern is easily adjustable. the lace body is a multiple of 18 + 1 stitches. adjust the number of co stitches for a wider or narrower item. add or subtract repeats to adjust the length.
* the beads are optional and can be omitted. you can also choose to reduce the number of beaded rows per section, if you desire.
* there is a five-stitch garter stitch border on the sides.
* placing additional stitch markers between the repeats will make counting easier. just slip the markers as you come to them.
* **if you do not wish to add beads to your work, work the k2tog+b stitch as a k2tog only.**
